item.title: CoreWeave to Buy Core Scientific in $9 Billion Stock Deal
item.description: CoreWeave Inc. is dropping $9 billion on the data-center operator Core Scientific Inc. in an effort to gain more direct control over the physical assets powering the artificial-intelligence boom.
item.dc:creator: Dana Wollman

media:content.media:description: CoreWeave Inc. signage during the company's IPO at the Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, on March 28.

item.title: Susquehanna Affiliate Buys $1 Billion IonQ Stake at 25% Premium
item.description: IonQ Inc. raised $1 billion in a sale of stock and warrants to an affiliate of Susquehanna International Group, in a deal priced at a 25% premium to the quantum computing company’s closing price on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: CANADA - 2025/05/09: In this photo illustration, the IonQ logo is seen displayed on a smartphone screen. (Photo Illustration by Thomas Fuller/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images)

item.title: Capgemini to Buy WNS for $3.3 Billion to Expand AI Offer
item.description: The French consulting company Capgemini SE has agreed to buy IT outsourcing firm WNS Holdings Ltd. for $3.3 billion in cash in a push to expand its presence in artificial intelligence, a technology investors fear could undermine the group’s business.
item.dc:creator: Julien Ponthus, Benoit Berthelot

item.title: Strategy Posts $14 Billion Unrealized Gain in Second Quarter
item.description: Michael Saylor’s Strategy registered an unrealized gain of $14.05 billion in the second quarter due to a rebound in Bitcoin’s price and a recent accounting change.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

media:content.media:description: Co-founder and executive chairman of Strategy Michael Saylor

item.title: Amazon’s Shopping Bot Falls Short of Prime Performance
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at the performance of Amazon’s shopping bot, Rufus.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr

media:content.media:description: Amazon Web Services signage at Nvidia GTC in San Jose.

item.title: Huawei’s AI Lab Fends Off Accusations It Copied Rival Models
item.description: Huawei Technologies Co.’s secretive AI research lab has pushed back against accusations it relied on rivals’ models to develop its own Pangu platform, taking the unusual step of rebutting claims about its artificial intelligence efforts.
item.dc:creator: Yuan Gao

item.title: Apple Supplier Lens Tech Said to Price $607 Million Hong Kong Listing at Top of Range
item.description: Apple Inc. supplier Lens Technology Co. has raised HK$4.8 billion ($607 million) after pricing its Hong Kong listing at the top of the marketed range, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti, Dave Sebastian

item.title: Apple Appeals ‘Unprecedented’ €500 Million EU App Store Fine
item.description: Apple Inc. appealed a €500 million ($580 million) fine from the European Union, calling the penalty “unprecedented” and the regulator’s required changes to its App Store as “unlawful.”
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app on a laptop arranged in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. Apple Inc. risks billions of euros of new fines over its App Store rules as European Union antitrust regulators escalated a growing conflict over rules that strike at the heart of the iPhone makers business model.

item.title: Uniqlo Owner, Seven & i To Set Tone for Japan’s Consumer Sector
item.description: Uniqlo owner Fast Retailing Co. and Seven & i Holdings Co. will show how Japan’s consumer sector is faring as Asia’s earnings season kicks off.
item.dc:creator: Reina Sasaki, Justina T Lee, Harshita Swaminathan

media:content.media:description: Uniqlo Park in Mitsui Outlet Park Yokohama Bayside in Yokohama. Photographer: Noriko Hayashi/Bloomberg

item.title: How Xiaomi Succeeded Where Apple Failed
item.description: Lei Jun, founder and chairman of Xiaomi Corp., the only tech company to have successfully diversified into carmaking, couldn’t resist.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew

media:content.media:description: Lei Jun introduces the Xiaomi YU7 during a launch event in Beijing on June 26.

item.title: Secret Service in US Expands a Global Push Against Crypto Scams
item.description: The scam began with a message, then a friendly exchange. A stranger directed the victim to a cryptocurrency investment site that appeared professional — slick design, charts, even customer support. The first deposit showed a modest profit. So did the next. Encouraged, the victim sent more, even borrowing money to keep up. Then, without warning, the platform stopped responding. The account balance disappeared.
item.dc:creator: Myles Miller

media:content.media:description: Secret Service investigative analyst and technical advisor Jamie Lam teaching Bermuda police officers and prosecutors how to trace cryptocurrency funds at Police Headquarters in Prospect, Bermuda, on June 25.
